product_overview: A modern, responsive portfolio website showcasing Laxmideepak Nelapatla's professional experience, skills, projects, and education with an Apple-inspired light and dark mode theme, optimized for multiple devices and enhanced with smooth animations and accessibility features.
core_goals: Showcase professional experience and skills accurately reflecting the latest resume updates.
Provide a visually appealing, responsive user interface with Apple-inspired light and dark themes and persistent theme switching.
Enable intuitive navigation with a glass morphism navigation bar, integrated time display, and responsive links to key sections.
Highlight multiple projects with technology stacks and responsive grid layouts without images or unnecessary buttons.
Present education and experience in modern timeline and card layouts with animations for engagement.
Offer a modal-based contact system with validation, alternative contact methods, and mobile optimization.
Ensure accessibility compliance (WCAG 2.1 AA) and cross-browser compatibility.
Maintain high performance with smooth animations, fast load times, and responsive design for all devices.
key_features: Apple-inspired theme system with light mode, dark mode featuring a cosmic/starry background, theme toggle with localStorage persistence.
Glass morphism navigation bar with integrated real-time clock and weather display, responsive design including Work, About, Contact links, and call-to-action buttons for email and resume download.
Hero section with animated 3D text effects, professional summary, and profile image with border effects.
Experience section with card-based layout, hover effects, achievement bullet points, and accurate job details.
Projects section showcasing over 6 projects with technology stack icons in a responsive grid layout, without project images or "View Details" buttons.
Skills section categorizing six skill groups with technology icons/emojis and responsive animated grid layout.
Education section with a modern timeline design, compact information boxes, consistent heading styles, and Framer Motion animations.
Modal-based contact form with validation, mobile-friendly design, and alternative contact methods including Email, GitHub, and LinkedIn.
Custom analytics hook for tracking user interactions and page views.
Mobile-first responsive design ensuring touch-friendly interactions and optimized text sizes.
Use of Next.js 15.2.4 with App Router and TypeScript for reliability, and Tailwind CSS for styling with Framer Motion animations for dynamic user experience.
user_flow_summary: User lands on the home page, greeted by an animated hero section with profile summary and role display.
User navigates via the glass morphism navigation bar to sections like Work, About, and Contact or toggles the theme between light and dark modes.
User explores the Experience section with interactive cards showing professional history and achievements on hover.
User browses the Projects section displayed in a responsive grid layout highlighting technology stacks without extraneous buttons or images.
User reviews skills grouped into categories with icons in an animated layout for quick assessment.
User views the Education section with a timeline format enhanced with smooth animations.
User opens the Contact modal from the navigation or contact button, fills and submits the form with validation, or accesses alternative contact methods.
Throughout the visit, the analytics system tracks user interactions for performance and usage insights.
validation_criteria: Theme switching toggles correctly and persists using localStorage.
Navigation links and buttons (Work, About, Contact, Email, Resume) function as expected on all devices.
The entire site layout is fully responsive for mobile, tablet, and desktop views with optimized touch interactions.
Framer Motion animations trigger smoothly for page transitions, hover effects, and interactive elements without jank.
Contact form modal opens properly, validates input fields, and submits successfully, delivering confirmation feedback.
Real-time clock in navigation updates accurately with the current time and date.
Content in Experience, Projects, Skills, and Education sections match the provided resume and source data.
All project links point to accessible Vercel deployments with correct technology displays.
Education titles and institution names appear with consistent heading styles and compact boxes.
Page load speed and animation performance meet smooth 60fps standards on modern devices.
Site complies with WCAG 2.1 AA accessibility guidelines, including screen reader compatibility.
Cross-browser compatibility verified on Chrome, Safari, Firefox on desktop and mobile browsers like iOS Safari and Chrome Mobile.
Mobile performance is optimized for touch interactions, scrolling, and responsive text sizing.
